loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander es un comerciante, emprendedor y muy  esforzado, su familia depende de sus ingresos, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos y además ofrece los servicios de recarga móvil y pago de servicios públicos, necesita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) con el que comprará recarga y mercadería para ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela. Manifiesta estar feliz de contar con este apoyo financiero.
texts.en: Alexander is a store keeper. He is entrepreneurial and a real go-getter. His family depends on his income. He has a business selling food and in addition he offers a mobile phone recharge service and payment of public services. He needs one million colones (¢1.000,000) which he will use to purchase phone time recharge and merchandise in order to offer better service to his customers. He expresses that he is pleased to have this financial support.

loans.use: to stock his store

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es: Keilyn, tiene la edad  de 23 años, está casada,  vive con el esposo y un  hijo actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar   ropa al por mayor para luego venderla a los vecinos y lugares aledaños ,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica y seguir creciendo con este proyecto  de venta de ropa. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Keilyn, 23, is married. She lives with her husband and her son. With the loan, she intends to buy wholesale clothing to then sell to the neighbors and in nearby areas. This is in order to earn a good income, a better quality of life, economic stability, and to keep growing with this clothing-sales project. This is the first loan that she has received from Fudecosur. She had not had other loans from state banks before, but Fudecosur has given her the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: La señora Santos tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y un hijo en una aldea del municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace 8 años que ella estableció su propio negocio de pulpería para vender productos de consumo diario como granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, huevos, harina, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, embutidos, condimentos, churros, dulces, pan, lácteos y otros productos de abarrotería. Ella ha sido cliente de ODEF por 6 ciclos de préstamos para mantener activo su negocio. El préstamo que ha solicitado actualmente es el séptimo ciclo el cual es por 20,000 lempiras y lo utilizara para surtir mas el negocio de granos básicos, productos enlatados, productos de limpieza, churros, manteca, azúcar, harina, lácteos, etc. con su negocio surtido podrá dar mejor atención a sus clientes. Tiene como meta hacer crecer más el negocio y obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Santos is 35 years old and lives with her husband and son in a village in the municipality of Esparta in the Department of Atlántida. Eight years ago, she started her own business, which is a small grocery store that sells everyday goods such as basic grains, sugar, lard, eggs, flour, canned goods, cleaning products, sausages, condiments, chips, candy, bread, dairy products and other groceries.

Santos has been a client of the field partner for six loan cycles, and she used the previous loans to maintain her business. She is requesting her seventh loan for 20,000 HNL to improve her stock of basic grains, canned goods, cleaning products, chips, lard, sugar, flour, dairy products and other groceries. Santos says that with her store well-stocked she will be able to provide better customer service. Her goal is to expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to improve her stock of basic grains, canned goods, cleaning products, chips, lard, sugar, flour, dairy products and other groceries

loans.name: Nelson Eden

texts.es: Nelson desde la edad de doce años se trasladó junto con sus padres a vivir en la comunidad donde actualmente vive con su esposa Sara con quien tiene un niño de tres años. El con mucho esfuerzo llegó hasta la escuela secundaria la que tuvo que dejar por tener que trabajar. En sus primeros trabajos fungió como ayudante de técnico en telecomunicaciones. Junto con su esposa y mucho esfuerzo logró adquirir su casa, donde empezó una micro tienda de víveres y productos básicos del hogar.  Con la ayuda de su esposa y de préstamos de comerciantes esta micro tienda ha ido creciendo. Hace un año se decidió a poner otra pequeña tienda del mismo giro a 20 kilómetros de su hogar en una hacienda de producción cafetalera. Poco a poco, con mucho esfuerzo y con ayuda de su esposa Nelson ha logrado establecer estas dos micro-tiendas, ha logrado comprar un medio de transporte para movilizarse y la casa de la familia. Solicita un crédito para adquirir un sistema solar para ponerlo en su segunda tienda ya que ahí no hay energía eléctrica y así poder servir mejor a sus clientes y poder atraer a más clientela.
texts.en:
At twelve years old, Nelson moved with his parents to live in the community where he currently lives with his wife Sara, with whom he has a three-year old son. He made it to secondary school with great effort, but had to drop out because he had to work. He worked as a telecommunications technician's assistant for his first jobs. With his wife and with a lot of effort, he was able to buy their house, where he started a small store selling groceries and basic home goods. 

With the help of his wife and loans from merchants, his small store has been growing. A year ago he decided to open another small grocery store 20 kilometers from his home on a coffee plantation. Little by little, with a lot of effort and with the help of his wife, Nelson has been able to establish these two small stores, and has managed to buy a means of transportation to get around as well as his family's house.

He is asking for a loan to buy a solar power system to put on his second store, as there is no electricity there. In this way he will be able to serve his customers better and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for his small store

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter vive en casa propia junto  a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 7 y 13 años de edad, él se dedica a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz, maicillo, y frijol desde hace 4 años, es una persona responsable, trabajadora con ganas de salir adelante, además muy reconocido en la zona, posee una clientela establecida que demanda sus productos, gracias a las labores que realiza ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Walter solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abono, fertilizantes, herramientas etc. Para poder obtener mayores ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Walter lives in his own house with his life partner and his sons, 7 and 13.  He has made a living for four years in agriculture growing corn, sorghum, and beans.  He's a responsible and hardworking person who wants to get ahead.  He's also very well known in the area and has steady customers who request his products.  Thanks to his work he has been able to pay a lot of his family expenses.

Walter's requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as seeds, soil amendments, fertilizers, tools, etc. so he'll earn more income and give his family the quality of life they deserve.

loans.use: to buy seeds, soil amendments, fertilizer, tools, etc.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina de 59 años de edad vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, ella posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace 19 años posee mucha clientela por la variedad de productos, los buenos precios y la amabilidad, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña reina está solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, sopas, aceites, etc. para surtir aun mas su tienda y poder generar mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reina is 59 years old and lives in a relative's home with her spouse and their four children. She has had a shop in her home for 19 years. She has a large customer base thanks to her variety of products, her good prices, and her friendly approach. She manages to pay for some of her household's expenses with earnings from her sales. 

Reina is requesting a loan to buy bulk grains, sweets, soft drinks, soups, oils, etc., to better stock her business. This way, she will be able to generate more earnings and give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk grains, candies, soft drinks, soups, oils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rebar, zinc sheets, plates, and a soldering iron.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Reina Del Pilar

texts.es: Reina vive junto a sus padres y su hijo de dos años de edad, ella se dedica a trabajar como empleada doméstica para poder contar con todo lo necesario para ella y su hijo ya que es madre soltera. Reina solicita un préstamo a FUSAI, con el cual pueda invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como madera, arena, láminas, entre otros más y de esta forma construir un cuarto más en su casa en donde pueda tener su propio espacio tanto para ella como para su pequeño hijo, ya que actualmente comparte habitación con los otros miembros de la familia.
texts.en:
Reina lives with her parents and her two year old son.  She works as a domestic employee in order to be able to have everything she and her son need because she is a single mother.

Reina is requesting a loan from FUSAI to be able to buy construction materials like wood, sand, and zinc sheeting, among others.  This way she will build another room at her house where she will be able to have her own space.  She will do this for herself as well as for her little son.  She currently shares a room with the other members of the family.

loans.use: to buy wood, sand, and other supplies to build a room.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Добрая и весьма приятная женщина несколько лет назад, потеряла своего мужа. Ее зовут Мавлуда. Ей 54 года. Она имеет 2 детей. Она заботливая мать для своих детей и хранительница домашнего очага. Мавлуда работает бухгалтером в организации. Полученную зарплату она использует для покупки продуктов питания. Кроме того, она имеет магазин возле своего дома. Она продает продукты питания. Мавлуда является основной кормилицей семьи. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: There is a kind and entirely pleasant woman who lost her husband a few years ago. Her name is Mavluda. She is 54 years old. She has two children. She is a homemaker and a caring mother to her children. Mavluda works as an accountant for an organization. She spends her salary on food. In addition, she has a shop near her home. She sells food products. Mavluda is the main breadwinner for the family. She plans to renovate their home since her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 KGS to buy construction materials such as cement, wood, etc. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy .

loans.use: to buy building materials such as wood and cement to repair her house.

loans.name: Mariano Antonio

texts.es: Mariano es padre de tres hijos,  con esfuerzo propio a logrado construir una vivienda pero las condiciones de la misma no son lo mejor para su familia, por esa razón quiere mejorar su casa, para esto soliciota un crédioty por quinientos cincuenta mil colones (¢550.000), con él comprará materiales de construcción para mejorar paredes, pisos, techo. Manifiesta Mariano su gran alegría por contar con este apoyo financiero
texts.en: Mariano is the father of three children. Through his own efforts he has managed to build a house, but it is not in the best condition for his family.  For that reason he wants to improve his house,  and for this is requesting a loan of 500,000 colons. With it he will buy construction materials for improving walls, floors, and roof. Mariano expresses his great happiness in having this financial assistance.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing his home.

loans.name: Lom's Group

texts.en:
Lom, 53, is a married mother living with her child in a rural village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She earns a living through farming rice for 33 years, earning about KHR 40,000 per day, and is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day after expenses for future needs.

Lom is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her business to earn a larger income to make her living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hermin Vladimir

texts.es: Hermin es un hombre emprendedor y activo de 27 años de edad que se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente; hace aproximadamente dos años inició su propio negocio de producción de mazamorra, esta actividad la realiza en su casa y luego sale a venderla en los diferentes barrios cercanos del sector donde reside, de esta manera ha logrado generar los ingresos necesarios para suplir las necesidades básicas en su hogar. Actualmente solicita el apoyo de un segundo ciclo crediticio, ya que desea invertir el dinero en la compra de insumos al por mayor (maíz, bicarbonato, pipeta de gas propano), así tendrá la posibilidad de aumentar su producción y sus ventas, esto se reflejará en el incremento de sus ingresos personales con los que seguirá avanzando para cumplir sus metas. Hermin desea seguir trabajando con esfuerzo, disciplina y dedicación ya que está muy contento con los resultados que le ha dado su negocio y además tiene la ventaja de manejar su propio tiempo, lo que según él significa mejorar la calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Hermin’s an active, enterprising, 27-year-old man who works independently.  About two years ago he started his own business making ‘mazamorra’ [pudding-like dessert made with purple corn and fruit].  He makes it at home and then heads out to various neighborhoods near where he lives to sell it.  He’s earned income this way sufficient to cover his basic household needs.

He’s  currently asking for a second loan because he wants to invest the money buying ingredients (corn, baking soda, tank of propane) at wholesale to be able to increase production and sales leading to increase personal income to continue advancing towards his goals.  Hermin wants to continue to work hard with discipline and dedication since he’s very happy with the results his business has had.  Another of his advantages is that he can manage his own time which according to him improves his quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies at wholesale.

loans.name: Younger Rodimiro

texts.es: Younger, tiene 49 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos con su esposa y reside en el Municipio de Yoro. El se ha dedicado a la agricultura y hace 8 años decidió por vender verduras de forma ambulante en una bicicleta, el ofrece repollo, tomate, papas, chile, bananos verdes, remolacha etc. a los negocios de pulperías de la zona y a sus alrededores. Con el propósito de incrementar sus ventas a solicitado un préstamo por 5,000 lempiras del cual va comprar repollo, tomate, chile verde, cebolla, bananos verdes, tomate, pataste y otros. su sueño es que algún día el negocio sea auto sostenible y tener solvencia económica para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Younger, 49, is married with three children.  He lives with his wife and children in the municipality of Yoro.  He’s worked in agriculture and 8 years ago decided to start selling vegetables going from place to place on a bicycle.  He sells cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, chilies, green plantain, beets, etc. to grocery stores in the zone and nearby areas.  

Aiming at increasing sales, he’s asked for a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy cabbage, tomatoes, green chilies, onions, green plantain, chayote and others.  His dream is that the business becomes self-sustaining someday and to have economic solvency so he and his family can get ahead.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо родилась в 1969 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она работает директором в средней школе. Ее старший сын и дочь учатся в университете в городе Москве. Ее младший сын учится в лицее. Зулайхо и ее муж хотят, чтобы их младший сын тоже поступил в университет как их старшие дети. Зулайхо должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в лицее. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulaykho was born in 1969. She is married and is raising three children. She works as a director in a high school. Her eldest son and daughter attend university in Moscow. Her youngest son is in high school. Zulaykho and her husband want their younger son to go to university like their older children do. Zulaykho must pay school fees for her youngest son. She is asking for a loan to pay for her son's studies. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: pay her son's school fees.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
Ana Lucía es madre de cuatro hijos, desde hace cinco años se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, vende sus productos   en un local que alquila en la comunidad donde vive, necesita comprar más mercadería
ya que se acerca una época importante para el comercio, solicita un millón de colones (¢1.000.000). Agradece el apoyo que se le brinda por medio de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Ana Lucía is mother of four children.  For the last five years she’s been selling clothes and shoes.  She sells her goods in a locale she rents in the community where she lives.  She needs to buy more merchandise because an important commercial season is approaching.  She’s requesting a million colones (¢1.000.000).  She’s grateful for the support provided by means of this loan.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela es madre de dos niños, tiene un negocio de venta de carnes,  en este trabajo pone su mayor esfuerzo ya que de él dependen sus niños y todos los gastos del hogar. Con esfuerzo propio ha adquirido parte del equipo necesario para desarrollar el proyecto, sin embargo necesita adquirir máquinas cortadoras y procesadores de carne, solicita un préstamo de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), su meta es el crecimiento del negocio, con lo cual obtendrá mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Mariela’s mother of two children. She has a butcher shop where she places her greatest effort for her children and all her household expenses depend on it.  With her own effort she’s been able to acquire some of the equipment necessary to carry out the project.  However, she needs to buy electric slicers and meat processing machines and is requesting a one-million colon loan (¢1.000.000) to do so.  Her goal is her business’ growth that will lead to higher income.

loans.use: to buy machinery for her butcher shop.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.es: Adelina de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo quien trabaja en una empresa privada, ella posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora que le llegan a comprar, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, doña Adelina solicita un crédito para la compra de  mas productos para surtir su tienda como: granos basicos, aceite, golosinas, refrescos, azucar, etc. y así satisfacer a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias, para que ella y su esposo tengan una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Adelina is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband. He works in a private company. She has had a small store in their house for the past few years. She has lots of clients because of the kindness with which she treats her customers when they come to her store. With the money she makes from her sales, and with the help from her husband they manage to pay some of the household expenses. 

Adelina is requesting this loan to buy more products to stock her store, such as basic grains, oil, sweets, soft drinks, sugar, etc. She wants to satisfy her customers and make more money so that her husband and her have a more stable financial situation..

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, sweets, soft drinks, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition to study English literature

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Kampong Cham province’s Ou Reang Ov district, Yeang is now 34 years old and married. She has two children, all of whom are too young for school. Yeang and her husband are farmers who grow rice and sell grocery items. Having been in the business for almost 18 years, they are able to make a daily earning of 14,000 KHR and manage to save about 5,000 KHR each day. 

This is the second loan for Yeang with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use a portion of it to pay for medicine for her husband. She hopes this loan will enable her to extend her rice growing and also hopes that her husband will get well soon from his illness.

loans.use: to pay for medicine for her husband

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Suria Lorena

texts.es: Suria, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene un hija y reside en el municipio de Choloma. Anteriormente trabajaba en una maquila, Tiene 6 años de tener su propio negocio de una pulpería, donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, embutidos, lácteos etc. El préstamo que solicita es el tercer ciclo y es por 15,000 Lempiras, el cual lo va utilizar en la compra de más productos para surtir el negocio como granos básicos, embutidos, lácteos, refrescos y otros. Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio y las ventas y poder darle el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
Suria, 33, is in a common law relationship with her husband and they have a daughter; she lives in the municipality of Choloma.  She used to work in an assembly plant but has had her own grocery store business for the last six years where she sells basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, cured meats, dairy products, etc.

The loan she’s asking for is her third and it’s for 15,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more products like basic grains, cured meats, dairy products, soft-drinks and others to stock her store.  Her objective is to improve business and sales to provide schooling for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Alimson Xiomara

texts.es: Alimson Xiomara de veintidós años de edad, es madre soltera  y vive junto a su pequeña hija de seis años de edad en casa propia. Ella es dueña de un molino, trabaja todos los días en su negocio para llevar el sustento al hogar; Alimson es una joven entusiasta, responsable y muy trabajadora, sabe que salir adelante sola no es nada fácil, pero lucha por tener una vida mejor; su vivienda está ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad, en una zona muy humilde, desde hace algún tiempo necesita encementar todo el piso de la casa, ya que aun es de tierra y eso genera mucho polvo, desea empezar la labor lo más pronto posible, para que su hija se encuentre en un ambiente más limpio. No posee de fondos económicos para cubrir los gastos de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena, grava. Alimson Xiomara está muy agradecida con la ayuda y compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Alimson Xiomara, 22, is a single mother living with her six-year-old daughter in a house of her own.  She owns a mill and works in her business every day to provide sustenance for her home.  Alimson is an enthusiastic, responsible, very hardworking young woman who knows that getting ahead alone isn’t easy but who strives to have a better life.  

Her house is located in a very humble zone in the city’s outskirts and for some time now she’s needed to lay a cement floor because it’s still dirt and creates much dust.  She wants to start the project as soon as possible so that her daughter can live in a cleaner environment.  

She does not have the financial resources to cover the cost of materials which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand and gravel.  Alimson Xiomara is very grateful for the help and commits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Dios me Fortalece está conformado por trece integrantes nueve  mujeres, cuatro varones. Ellos son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables, con ánimo de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de  la compañia de su familia, y pasar tiempo de calidad. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo  cursar una carrera universitaria y se vieron obligados  a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Inés es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanía nacional de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación ella ofrece, jarrones, floreros, al cancillas de barro, ollas, comales. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias, actividad que la disfruta con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía para obtener mejores ingresos en un futuro no muy lejano. El banco comunal  Dios  me Fortalece agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Dios Me Fortalece” (God Strengthens Me) consists of 13 members, 9 women and 4 men.  They are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the central part of the country.  The members are known as hardworking and responsible people who are eager to succeed on a personal level.  Whenever they have spare moments, they enjoying being their families and having quality time with them.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, the members did not obtain university degrees since they were obligated to work at a young age so that they could help with the household expenses.  

Thanks to her efforts and her drive to succeed, Inés serves as the Communal Bank coordinator.  She has a business of selling Honduran crafts as a street vendor and from her house.  Inés offers urns, flower vases, coin banks made of clay, pots, and griddles.  She works at her business about eight hours a day and enjoys what she does very much.  The purpose of this loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling crafts.  As a result, she will be able to generate more income in the not-so-distant future.  

The Communal Bank “Dios Me Fortalece” appreciates the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy handcrafted products to sell such as urns, flower vases, coin banks made of clay, pots, and griddles.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal las Mercedes está conformado por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un hombres madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de León lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente  del país.  en sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos, le preparan platos típicos de la región como “Nacatamal” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar una carrera y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Norma es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general como jeans, camisas, blusas, vestidos, faldas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, toalla, camisetas, camisolines, cosméticos. Actividad que dedica unas 10 horas diarias de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Las Mercedes agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Las Mercedes Communal Bank is made up of eight members, seven women and one man, responsible mothers and fathers with 15 children to take care of.  They are from León, which is located in the western region of the country.  They like to spend their free time with their children and make typical regional dishes such as nacatamal.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were not able to pursue degrees and instead had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. 

Norma is the communal bank's coordinator, thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead.  She sells general merchandise, such as jeans, tops, blouses, dresses, underwear, bed linens, towels, t-shirts, camisoles, and cosmetics.  She spends 10 hours a day on her business, both on foot and in her home.  Her loan is to be invested in working capital and to stock her business so that she can make more profits in the near future.  The Las Mercedes Communal Bank is thankful for the support Kiva's lenders offer to people with limited resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can do respectable work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business buying and selling general merchandise such as jeans, tops, blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, bed linens, towels, t-shirts, camisoles, and cosmetics

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza, está conformado por diez integrantes, nueve mujeres y un hombre. Madres y padres de familia responsables de quince hijos. Son originarios de Malpaisillo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracias a su esfuerzo   y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Basilisa y tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de artesanía de barros, casa de barro, floreros, adornos de cocina, cucharas de barros, jarrones, maceteros, alconcillas. Ella dedica a su actividad unas ocho horas diarias, actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación y forma ambulante y por encargos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de  material para elaborar artesanía como barro, arcilla, pintura, pincel, molde. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Mi Dios es Mi fortaleza, agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The community bank Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza [My God is My Strength] comprises ten members:  nine women and one man.  They are mothers and fathers who are responsible for a total of fifteen children.  They hail from Malpaisillo, a place that is situated in the western part of the country.  They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and with personal desires to get ahead.  Unfortunately, they were not able to study due to a lack of economic resources, and they felt obligated to work from a young age in order to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Basilisa.  She makes her living making and selling clay handicrafts, clay houses, flower vases, kitchen decorations, clay spoons, pitchers, flower pots and piggy banks.  She works some eight hours a day.  She works out of her house, from door-to-door, and by orders.

The goal of the loan is to invest it in working capital to buy material to make handicrafts, like mud, clay, paint, brushes and molds, so that in a not-so-distant future, she can get better earnings.

The community bank Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they have a means of making a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business of producing and selling handicrafts such as clay houses, flower vases, kitchen decorations, clay spoons, pitchers, flower pots, and piggy banks.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a milk seller by profession; she sells milk in her community. She has been selling milk along with her husband for many years. Her husband sells milk in a nearby town and she sells in their neighborhood. In this way both contribute to household expenses.
 
Shamim is 38 years old, living with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Day by day, the needs of her family are increasing but her source of income still remains constant. Therefore, Shamim requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she could grow her source of income. With the loan amount she will buy a cow, with the contribution of savings, to get more milk to sell. 

Shamim says thank to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a cow for getting milk.

loans.name: Chhoeurm's Group

texts.en: Chhoeurm is married and a mother of seven children, two of whom are still in school and dependent on her. She lives in a local area of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district and she is 61 years old. To make a living, she manages four hectares of farmland to do rice farming as a main source of her family’s income. She has been involved in this current business for 30 years and the main challenge of her business is lack of capital to buy fertilizer for her farmland. This is the seventh cycle loan for Chhoeurm and she has completely repaid back her previous loans. The past loans have improved her business gradually. Now she has formed a group of three members to take out a new loan and she is the group leader. She and her group members are applying for a loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will use her loan portion to buy seven sacks of fertilizer for her farmland and pay for plowing and transplantation fees. She hopes to increase more cash-crop yield than before to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seven sacks of fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Gerardo Edwin

texts.es: Don Gerardo es un señor muy esforzado, el toda su vida ha trabajo produciendo leche en una pequeña granja familiar. El le ha dado el sustento a su familia con la producción de la leche, pero actualmente necesita de mayores ingresos para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. por lo que necesita de un préstamo de novecientos mil colones(900.000) para comprar una vaca lechera y aumentar la producción. Don Gerardo esta muy contento ya que con esto va a poder solventar las necesidades de él y de su familia.
texts.en: Gerardo’s a very determined man who has worked his entire life producing milk in a small family farm.  He has supported his family by means of milk production but he currently needs to increase income in order to give his family better quality of life which is why he needs a nine-hundred-thousand (900.000) colon loan to buy a dairy cow and increase production.  Gerardo is very happy because with this he’ll be able to meet his and his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Roque

texts.es: Roque, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está casado, vive con su hijo y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que a  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roque, 54, is married and lives with his wife and child, who are his biggest priority.

With his loan he plans to buy fertilizer and fungicide, pay for labor to help with the coffee crop, and buy some seedlings to replant so he can increase the density of plants in the field.  He also wants to make the most of the good soil fertility as well as climate and other conditions that favor coffee production.

Roque hopes to earn some more profit and improve his family's living conditions with these improvements.  He also wants to invest a little more in the crop as well as achieve some goals.

This is Roque's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hadn't had previous loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to invest in his coffee crop

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es: María Genoveva de sesenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su hijo mayor de edad en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de chocolate en tablilla y harina de maíz tostado, además su hijo es empleado, trabaja para  ayudarle a completar los gastos del hogar; María es una mujer entusiasta y muy perseverante, le ha sido difícil salir adelante por su condición económica, pero sigue luchando por una vida mejor, su vivienda se ubica en una zona rural, es muy humilde y está deteriorada por eso quiere realizarle unas reparaciones, necesita cambiar la lamina del techo porque se filtra el agua, además quiere cambiar los polines porque están podridos y eso les genera inseguridad; espera realizar los cambios lo más rápido posible pero no posee de capital para la compra de los materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar lamina galvanizada y polines. María Genoveva está muy contenta con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar los pagos establecidos.
texts.en:
María Genoveva, 64, lives with her adult son in her own house. She works making and selling chocolate by the tablet and roasted corn flour.  Her son is employed and works to help her with household expenses.  

María’s an enthusiastic, very perseverant woman for whom getting ahead has been difficult due to her economic condition but she continues striving for a better life.

Her house is in a very humble, rural zone and it’s deteriorated which is why she wants to do some repairs.  She needs to replace the roof metal sheets because they leak water.  She also wants to replace the roof purlins that have rotted away and cause danger.  

She hopes to do these changes as soon as possible but does not have capital to buy the building supplies which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets and roof purlins.  María Genoveva is very happy with the support and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Kim is aged 61 years and is a widowed mother of three children. She and her husband make a living farming rice through planting cassava, which they have been doing for 41 years. The current business earns them about 40,000 KHR per day, and they are able to save about 20,000 KHR daily for their future needs. 

This is the second loan for Kim with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops to sell for a good price to make her family’s living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Lorn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Oun Reang Ov district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Lorn, 48, is married with two children. She and her husband grow rice. Having been in the business for almost 30 years, they can earn about 48,000 KHR per day to respond to the family’s needs and manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day. 

Lorn has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle already and she wisely and successfully used the past loan to improve her family’s livelihood. To better support her current business, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income so as to improve her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Naranbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Naranbaatar, 36 years old, lives with his mother and two brothers in an old house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been carrying passengers between Ulaanbaatar and Khentii province since 2010 after securing the license. Before this, he had rendered taxi service to local people for five years. His mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. His one brother also renders transportation services to local people. He is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house in preparation for the upcoming winter. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana de treinta y siete años de edad vive junto a sus cinco hijas, 4 menores de edad y una mayor de edad  en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta de pan francés y pan dulce, además su hija mayor le ayuda con los gastos y el padre de las niñas también le da un pequeño aporte; Juana es una mujer audaz y decidida siempre está a la expectativa de una vida mejor para su familia, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y desde hace algunos meses quiere realizar unos arreglos, necesita poner dos ventanas ya que solo están tapadas con un pedazo de lamina y también cambiar las laminas de la cocina porque están picadas y se filtra el agua; desea empezar el trabajo pero por su baja condición económica no puede cubrir el gasto de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar dos ventanas y lamina galvanizada. Juana está muy alegre con la ayuda y espera corresponder con los pagos.
texts.en:
Juana, 37, lives in her own house with her five children four of which are minors and one an adult.  She works selling French and sweet bread and her oldest daughter helps her with expenses.  The girls’ father also makes a small contribution.  

Juana is a bold, determined woman who is always seeking a better life for her family.  Her house is located in a rural zone and for some months now has needed repairs.  She needs to install two windows that currently are covered with pieces of metal sheeting and also replace the kitchen’s roof sheeting which has holes in it and lets the rain in.  

She wants to start the project but her low economic condition does not allow her to cover cost of materials which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan to buy two windows and galvanized metal sheets.  Juana is very happy with the support and expects to do her part by making the payments.

loans.use: to buy two windows and galvanized metal sheeting.

loans.name: Las Marias Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal  Las Marías está conformado por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un hombre. Padre y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. En sus ratos libres, le gusta disfrutar de la compañia de sus hijos. Estas personas son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos.

Gracias a su esfuerzo julia es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería, ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergentes, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener  mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Las Marías agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Las Marías Communal Bank is made up of nine members, eight women and one man who are responsible mothers and fathers with fifteen children in their care. They enjoy spending their free time with their children. These people are from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country, and are known as hardworking and responsible people who want to improve themselves. Unfortunately they were unable to go to school because they lacked the financial resources.

Julia's the coordinator of the group thanks to her effort. Her economic activity is a "pulpería" located in her home. A pulpería is a small store that sells food such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, detergent, juice, and soda.  She works about 10 hours a day at her job so she can earn better income in the near future.

Las Marías Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means to a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in her store by buying edible products such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, and sodas

loans.name: Manuel Martín

texts.es: Don Manuel es un hombre muy luchador. el produce leche y queso para vender, y con esto generar la ganancia para alimentar a su familia. ahora el necesita aumentar la producción de leche para poder ayudar mas a su familia con los gastos de la casa. por lo que necesita de un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar 2 vacas lecheras y aumentar la producción, y así tener mas ganancias que ayuden a la superación de su familia.
texts.en: Manuel is a very determined man. He produces milk and cheese to sell and thereby generate the income to feed his family. Now he needs to increase milk production so that he can further help his family with the household expenses. So he needs a loan of one million (1,000,000) colons to buy two milk cows and increase production, so that he can have more earnings that help improve his family's situation.

loans.use: To buy cattle for dairy production.

loans.name: Jose Ambrosio

texts.es:
José de 50 años d edad, esta acompañado, tiene 2 hijos, el hijo que vive con ellos en casa y es independiente y vive con su pareja, la  hija vive en el extranjero. Solo pudo estudiar hasta tercer grado, por falta de recurso económicos y porque la única escuela a la que podía asistir quedaba demasiado lejos.

Tiene 18 años de trabajar como agricultor,  aprendió todo lo que sabe con sus padres que eran productores de café. Trabajo también fabricando ladrillos de barro, pero al ver mejores frutos en la actividad agrícola decidió hacerse agricultor.  La señora se decida a la explotación de aves ponedoras y pollos de engorde y así contribuye a los ingresos familiares. José dedica 7 horas de trabajo a su cultivo, camina medio kilometro para llegar al lugar. También cuida una casa de un amigo y recibe un pago de 50 dólares cada quince días.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo y la compra de fertilizante foliar para regar en el cultivo de frijol que sembrara. Además pagara mano de obra para la recolección de la cosecha de maíz.
   
José pretende reparar los cercos de su terreno y en seguida comprar ganado y obtener de ahí otros ingresos, por otra parte dice que con las ganancias de la venta de los granos, quiere ayudar a su esposa a mejorar las galeras donde tienes sus pollos, evitar que se mojen ya que esto le causa estrés al animal lo que se traduce en bajos rendimiento y por ende baja rentabilidad.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, in a relationship, and has two children. One of them lives in their house together with a partner. The other lives abroad. José was only able to study until third grade due to lack of economic resources, and because the only school that he could attend was too far away.

He has been working in agriculture for 18 years, he learnt everything he knows from his parents who were coffee producers. He also worked making bricks, but when he realized that he would earn more in agriculture he decided to become a farmer. His partner works with poultry for laying and fattening, contributing in that way to the family's income. José works seven hours a day with his cultivations, he walks half a kilometer to reach the place. He also takes care of a friend's house for which he receives 50 USD every two weeks. 

He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for the beans that he will cultivate. He will also pay for workforce to harvest corn. José plans to repair the fence around his piece of land and then buy livestock, thus obtaining more income. He says that he wants to use the profit from selling grains to help his wife improve the chicken pens where she keeps her poultry, in order to prevent them from getting wet since this causes them to feel stressed, which leads to low yields and thus low profitability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for workforce to harvest corn and sow beans

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel 66 años de edad, es casado y tiene 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad e independientes. Debido a que la familia de Daniel era muy numerosa y de excasos recursos, no pudo estudiar. Actualmente vive con su esposa, que se dedica  a ser ama de casa

Es agricultor, desde niño aprendio a trabajar con su  padre, ademas aprendio a criar ganado, todos los dias se la levanta a las 3 de la mañana a ordeñar sus vacas, para luego trabajar en su cultivo, que se encuentra a 500 mts de su casa. Despues de trabajar la tierra, tiene que regresar el ganado a su sitio de descanso.

El prestamo sera utilizado para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y plaguicidas, ademas tiene que preparar 7,000 mts cuadrados de terreno para sembrar maìz.

Daniel quiere seguir trabajando independientemente, con las ganancias que le deja la venta de la cosecha quiere comprar un par de novillas.
texts.en:
Daniel, 66, is married and has six children, all of whom are adults and live independently. Given that Daniel's family is a large one with little resources, he was unable to study. He currently lives with his wife who works as a homemaker.

Daniel is a farmer, from a young age he learned to work with his father and he also learned to rear cattle. Every day he gets up at 3 am to milk his cows and then tend to his crop at 500 meters from his hole. After toiling the land, he has to lead the cattle back to their resting place.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizers, herbicides and fungicides as well as to prepare 7,000 square meters of land to sow corn. Daniel wants to continue working independently and with the profits that he has left over from the sale of the harvest, he wants to buy a pair of heifers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, fungicides and prepare the land for sowing.

loans.name: Santos Asemción

texts.es:
Santos es un hombre de 39 años de edad, solo estudio hasta  9° grado, es casado; su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a vender  antojitos típicos, ellos tienen 4 hijos que se encuentran estudiando el primer hijo tiene 17 años y estudia 2do año de bachillerato y a la vez trabaja en los tiempos libres en la agricultura, el segundo tiene 14 años y estudia 9° grado y también trabaja, el tercero tiene 12 y estudia 7° grado y el cuarto tiene 10 años y estudia 3° grado, el número de personas que viven y que depende de él son 6 personas. 
 
Don Santos, presta sus servicios de vigilancia desde hace 2 años. Para llegar a su lugar de trabajo, tiene que caminar un kilómetro  y medio para tomar el autobús. Aprendió este trabajo gracias a la ayuda de un amigo que lo recomendó y pudo entrar a laborar en la empresa y porque ya había prestado su servicio militar y esto le facilito mas  poder aprender del trabajo. El horario que tiene es de 7:00 AM  a 4:00PM.  Antes de  realizar  esta actividad Santos realizaba trabajos de jornalero y de agricultura en los alrededores.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para enladrillar el piso de su vivienda, ya que es de tierra por el momento. El crédito le ayudara a tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia, la necesidad que tiene es poner el piso de ladrillo para no estar expuestos a enfermedades
texts.en:
Santos, 39, is married. His wife works in domestic tasks and also sells typical snacks. They have four children who are in school. Their first child is 17 and in the second year of high school; at the same time, he works as a farmer in his free time. The second child is 14 and in ninth grade, and also works. The third is 12 and is in seventh grade, and the youngest is 10 and in third grade. There are six people who life in Santo's home and depend on him. Santos went to school through ninth grade.

Santos has been selling his security services for two years. To get to work, he has to walk one and a half kilometers to take the bus. He learned about this work from the help of a friend who recommended it and he was able to start working in the business. Also, because he had already completed his military service and this also helped him learn he skills of this job. His schedule is from 7am to 4pm. Before he worked in this job, Santos had various jobs including a day laborer and farmer in the surrounding area.

He is requesting this loan to put a brick floor in his home because it is dirt right now. This loan will help him improve his family's quality of life. He needs to put in a brick floor to prevent exposure to disease.

loans.use: to put a brick floor in his home.

loans.name: Carlos Arnoldo

texts.es:
Carlos de 40 años de edad, solo pudo realizar sus estudios hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos, todos asisten a la escuela. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios de la casa.

Tiene cerca de 4 años de  ser negociante de ganado, compra y revende animales, todo y empezó con este oficio realizando viajes en un camión a ganaderos, al ser muy observador, se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio y que dejaba ganancias y se sabía administrar, con el tiempo se decidió comprar ganado y revenderlo y desde entonces es un ingreso más para la familia, porque todavía hace viajes en camión y transporta materiales de construcción. 

Todos los días se levanta a las 4 de la mañana  viaja cerca de 20 kilómetros y  regresa a su casa a las 3 de la tarde.
Con el préstamo va a comprar 4 novillos para engordarlos y luego venderlos esperando tener buenas ganancias, y luego meterse al negocio de la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Carlos 40 years of age, was able to carry out his studies until ninth grade, he lives with his wife and four children, all attend the school. His wife is dedicate to house chores.

Has close to 4 years of being a trader of cattle, buys and resells animals. He started with this business transporting livestock to ranchers. He is a good observer and realized that it was a good business with good profits and that he knew how to manage. After sometime, he decided to purchase cattle and resell it. Since then, he has more income for the family because he is still transporting goods and materials of construction.

Every day, he gets up at four in the morning to travel approximately 20 kilometers and returns to his home at three in the afternoon. 
With the loan, he will buy four steers for fattened and then sell. Waiting to have good profit, and then get into the business of milk production.

loans.use: buy four steers for fattened

loans.name: Brenda Lizeth

texts.es:
La señora Brenda es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su hijo. Su negocio es la  compra y  venta  de cerdos desde hace 3 años.
Doña Brenda vende los cerditos desde su casa de habitación y necesita el préstamo para la compra de cerdos, espera que el préstamo le ayude mucho ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para seguir trabajando es su negocio.
Doña Brenda espera que esta inversión le genere un aumento en las ventas y con esto ganar más ingresos que beneficien el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar. Ella espera aumentar su negocio y seguir apoyando a su hijo en sus estudios para que tenga mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras – Septiembre del  2013
texts.en:
Brenda is a very hard-working and responsible person.  She lives with her son in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  Her business, which she has been doing for three years, is buying and selling pigs.  Brenda sells the pigs from her house.

She needs the loan to buy pigs.  She hopes that the loan with help her a lot.  This is because she does not have the capital needed to continue working in her business.  Brenda hopes that this investment will generate an increase in sales.  With this she will earn more income, which will benefit the family’s lifestyle at home.  She hopes to increase her business and continue supporting her child in his education so that he has greater opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2013

loans.use: to buy pigs for her business.

loans.name: Rodolfo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Rodolfo Antonio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como Higienista  en una institución del estado con mucho años de estabilidad. En estos momentos está atravesando momentos difíciles económicos.

Don Rodolfo Antonio está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de  medicamentos y una series de exámenes clínico para su hijo que se encuentra mal de salud. A la vez se siente bien agradecido ya que gracias al crédito obtenido por kiva-ceprodel ha venido mejorando sus condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Rodolfo Antonio lives in Managua.  He works as a hygienist in a state institution.  He has had many stable years.  At this time, however, he is facing some financial difficulties. 

Don Rodolfo Antonio is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of medications and a series of clinical tests for his son, who is not in good health.  At the same time, done Rodolfo Antonio feels quite grateful.  Thanks to the loan he is receiving through Kiva-Ceprodel, he is improving his family's condition.

loans.use: to purchase medications and a series of clinical tests for his son

loans.name: Dolores Concepcion

texts.es:
Dolores, se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas, tiene 35 años de edad, está acompañada su esposo tiene 30 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, uno de ellos estudia bachiller y el otro tiene 3 años de edad.
Dolores, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida y bebidas en el centro de la ciudad, tiene tres años de poseerlo y trabaja de lunes a sábado. Ella necesita realizar la compra de bebidas por mayoreo y productos de la canasta básica para la elaboración de la comida, para esto solicita un préstamo que cubra esta necesidad en su negocio.
Con el préstamo lograra incrementar su disponibilidad de producto al negocio y fortalecerlo más, mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Dolores is a 35-year old woman who works selling food and drinks. She lives with her husband (30 years old) and their two children, one of whom is in high-school and the other is 3 years old. She has had her own business selling food and drinks in the city center for 3 years and works Monday through Saturday. 

She needs to buy drinks in bulk and basic products to make the food, which is why she is requesting a loan to cover expenses. Thanks to this loan, she expects to increase her products' availability and to grow her business, improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy drinks in bulk and basic products.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam es originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos. Desde 1995 tiene una pulpería,localizada en su propia vivienda. En su pequeño negocio vende diversos productos, tales como: granos básicos, chiverías.

Tiene 14 años de acceder a créditos con PANA PANA, lo que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda por etapas, con el proposito de contar con un espacio seguro donde vivir, que le brinde  proteccion de las inclemencias climáticas. Actualmente esta realizando reparaciones en el techo de la vivienda, por medio de las ganancias que percibe de su  negocio. Tambien le ha permitido apoyar y luchar por sus hijos. 

Recientemente ha solicitado un nuevo crédito para ampliar y mejorar su vivienda, con el objetivo de vivir de manera segura, digna, ir progresando y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Miriam is from Puerto Cabezas. She is 51 years old, and the single mother of five children. Since 1995 she has had a small grocery store located in her own home. In her small store she sells various products such as basic staples and snacks.

She has been accessing loans through Pana Pana for 14 years, which has allowed her to improve her home by stages with the goal of having a secure place to live that protects her from harsh weather. Currently she is carrying out roof repairs to the home by means of the profits she earns from her business. It has also allowed her to support her children and strive for their sake.

Recently she has requested a new loan to gradually expand and improve her home, with the aim of living in a secure and decent way, and moving forward little by little and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to improve her home in order to offer more security and protection from harsh weather

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en: A rural villager from Battambang province, Son is 48 years old and a mother of one child. To support the daily expenses of her family, she grows rice on one and a half hectares of farmland, while her husband is a paid worker to earn extra income for her family. The current business, which she has been with for 10 years, has returned her about 40,300 KHR per day. This is the fifth loan cycle for Son with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has successfully repaid her past loans and it has helped her to improve her living condition gradually. Now, she leads a group of four members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing fees for her agribusiness. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income so as to set aside some money when she gets old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide and to pay for plowing fees

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
Ivonne es una mujer luchadora, sociable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 44 años de edad, madre soltera, de un adolescente que con el  apoyo de su madre está saliendo adelante, a pesar de los problemas de salud que padece. 

Con los 24 años de experiencia de docencia que tiene doña Ivonne, le ha permito sacar adelante a su hijo. Recientemente, solicita financiamiento para mejorar su vivienda, particularmente su cocina, construirla con azulejos, bonita, hacer un bajarete y área de lavado y viajar a Managua con su hijo, para realizarle los exámenes médicos.
   
Su sueño es continuar apoyando a su hijo en cada una de las etapas de su vida, para que llegue a convertirse en un profesional de éxito, realizarle mensualmente los exámenes médicos para darle seguimiento a su enfermedad, reparar poco a poco la vivienda, para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Anteriormente había recibido un préstamo con Pana Pana, el cual le permitió ponerle cielo razo a su vivienda y realizarle el chequeo médico a su pequeño y único hijo, que es la razón de su existencia.
texts.en:
Ivonne is a friendly, hard working woman from Puerto Cabezas.  She is 44 years old, single mother of a teenager that is succeeding with his mother’s help, despite the health problems he suffers.  

Ivonne’s twenty-four years of teaching experience has helped her get her son ahead.  Recently, she requested a loan to improve her home, her kitchen in particular.  She installed nice tiles and constructed a covered porch and laundry area.  She travels with her son to Managua for his medical appointments. 

Her dream is to continue supporting her son through each stage of his life so that he becomes a successful professional, ensure that her son has monthly medical exams to follow-up his illness, and to gradually repair her home to improve her quality of life. 
 
Previously, she received a loan from Pana that allowed her to install a ceiling in her home, and pay for a medical check-up for her small and only son, who is her reason for living

loans.use: To build a kitchen and area to wash clothes

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 20-year-old Lebanese single man. He started his career at a very young age working as a mechanic. He works at his own garage serving customers with his professional skills. He is specialized at repairing motorcycles. Today, he is asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase the needed mechanical supplies to be able to enhance his repairs. This is his first Kiva loan and we note that Mahmoud is very motivated to achieve what he is intending for and he is sure that he will gain good profits and live in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase the needed mechanical supplies

loans.name: Jhohattan Omar

texts.es: Jhohattan de veintidós años de edad vive junto a su madre y su hermana en casa propia. El se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce, es un negocio familiar, trabaja todos los días junto a su madre y hermana para lograr el sustento diario; Jhohattan es un joven emprendedor, capaz y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, su vivienda está ubicada a las afueras de la ciudad y necesita realizar algunos cambios, desea poner puertas y ventanas con balcón porque son más seguras quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, porque por el momento solo las cubren con laminas, pero debido a su condición económica no posee de capital que lo respalde para la compra de los materiales, por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar puertas de hierro y ventanas con balcón. Jhohattan está muy contento con la ayuda y se siente comprometido a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Jhohattan is twenty-two years old and in his own house with his mother and sister.  He makes and sells sweet breads.  It is a family business - he works every day with his mother and sister to support their cost of living.


Jhohattan is a young entrepreneur, capable and willing to move out ahead.  His house is located in the suburbs of the city and needs some changes.  He wants to install doors and windows with iron grilles because they are safer.  He wants to start work as soon as possible because for the time-being they are just covered with pieces of metal.  However, because of the economic condition he doesn't have the capital to which would enable him to buy the materials.  Therefore, he's requesting a loan from FUSAI which would allow him to buy doors and windows with metal grilles.  Jhonattan is very happy with the help and feels committed to pay the debt.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows with iron grilles

loans.name: Sadiqan

texts.en:
Sadiqan is aged 55. She is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Her daughters are married and living at their homes happily. Her husband is an old man, now he does not participate in household expenses. 

Her elder son supports the whole family. He is responsible for all expenses and utility bills. He is a hardworking and zealous young man. He owns a general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her son is unmarried and she wants to arrange a marriage for him.

She wants her younger son to also start this business in another place so that he could also become a person who earns. Her son has hired a shop but does not have money to buy inventory to run a general store. Therefore, Sadiqan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son would be able to buy the stock of inventory such as pulses, flour, sugar, biscuits, rice etc. She hopes that her younger son will understand his responsibilities toward his family and carry on his business as her elder son is doing.

Sadiqan says thank you to Kiva and hopes that the lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man. In 2007, he decided to open a communication shop where he sells a wide variety of mobiles and related accessories. Today, and with the aim to support his business, Ahmad is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to implement a UPS system at his store. In that way, he will pay less for electricity and therefore will be able to collect more money and live in better conditions. As for his future plans, Ahmad is seeking to open a new branch of his shop and will maybe sell products other than mobiles.

loans.use: to implement a UPS system

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida manages a variety store, eatery and engaged herself into direct selling business. She has run her variety store since 2002 up to now. Lida is separated having two grown up children. Since 1990 she stands as both father and mother to her two children. Despite her situation as single parent, Lida didn't stop believing that someday she could be a better entreprenuer someday.

Lida would like to ask for a loan of PHP7,000 allows her to purchase school supplies and necessary stocks of grocery items for her variety store. She believes that her hard work and additional capital would help make her dreams possible. So she's looking forward for approval of her requested loan. In this way, she could sustain her family needs and somehow obtain better profit which will serve as her savings for her emergency purposes when she got weak.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies and necessary stocks of grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Ana Dilia

texts.es:
Ana Dilia es una joven de 27 años de edad, ama de casa y agricultora, en un estado civil en unión libre, madre de 1 hijo el cual está recién nacido. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario cursado hasta el cuarto grado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron apoyarle para que ella pudiese seguir estudiando. Fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra a muy temprana edad ya que en su familia es una tradición que viene de generación en generación. En compañía de su conyugue diariamente se dirigen hasta sus cultivos de café caminando por 20 minutos los cuales son propios gracias a una herencia familiar.

Ella actualmente ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual pretende comprar fertilizantes y abonos con lo que ayudaran mediante la aplicación de estos insumos a mantener limpio sus cultivos de café siendo esta su única actividad económica de ingreso para su familia.

Sus metas son los de poder cultivar una mejor y mayor variedad de café, que sea competitiva en el mercado por su calidad y por su sabor como el borbone entre otros que son de gran éxito en el mercado. Sus sueños son los de poder mejorar la condición de vida de su familia y seguir adelante con cada uno de los proyectos que tiene para triunfar en la vida teniendo como prioridad la educación de su hijo y el fortalecimiento del patrimonio.
texts.en:
Ana Dilia is 27 years old and in a common-law marriage. She is a farmer and a homemaker, and she has one newborn son. Ana Dilia finished the fourth grade, but she was unable to stay in school because her parents did not have enough money. Her parents taught her how to work the land at a very young age, maintaining the family tradition of farming, which has been passed on for generations. Every day, Ana Dilia and her husband walk 20 minutes to reach their fields, which they own thanks to a family inheritance.  

Ana Dilia is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy fertilizers and manure to keep her coffee crops well-maintained. She says that coffee growing is her family’s only source of income. Ana Dilia says that her goal is to improve her coffee and to grow more varieties. She hopes that her coffee will compete in the marketplace, like Borbone and other successful varieties, because of its quality and flavor. Ana Dilia dreams to improve her family’s quality of life and to move ahead with her plans to be successful. She says that her priorities are her son’s education and strengthening her family’s legacy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to keep her coffee crops well-maintained

loans.name: Sithou's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sithou is 28 years old and married. She has three children who are still in school. She is a rice farmer and she also plants cassava. She has been in this business for several years, earning about KHR 45,000 per day, and is able to save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.
 
Sithou is just with VisionFund this cycle and she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice and cassava healthily and fruitfully and also hopes to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Sokha, a mother of three children, is a resident from the Sangke district of Battambang province. To stablize their living condition, she and her husband work for others for a fee as their main source of income. This business has returned her family about 16,700 KHR. This is the first loan for Sokha’s group with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The total amount of her entire group loan is 1,000,000 KHR. Sokha, whose loan portion is 300,000 KHR and is the group leader, will spend her loan to buy two pigs for raising for extra income. She hopes that she can gain a good income from this business so that she can expand this business on a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy two pigs for raising for extra income

loans.name: Veronica Lissette

texts.es: Verónica Lissette de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos uno de 11 años y el otro de 10 años en casa propia. Ella posee un molino de nixtamal y trabaja todos los días en el negocio, además su esposo es empleado y con eso le ayuda a completar los gastos del hogar; Verónica es una mujer joven, audaz y muy capaz de salir adelante con su familia quiere lo mejor para ellos, su vivienda está ubicada en una zona rural y el piso de es de tierra, necesita encementar para evitar el polvo y mantener más limpio para sus hijos; no posee de fondos económicos para cubrir los gastos de materiales por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar cemento, arena y grava. Verónica Lissette está muy alegre con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Verónica Lissette is 29 years old and lives with her spouse and their 2 children, who are 11 and 10 years old, in a house that they own.  She owns a corn mill and works there everyday.  Her husband is also employed, and helps her to cover their household expenses.  Verónica is a bold, young woman who is very capable of pulling her family ahead, and wants the best for them.  

Her home is located in a rural area and has a dirt floor.  In order to avoid dust and keep it cleaner, she must make a concrete floor.  She does not have the necessary funds to cover the cost of the materials, which is why she is seeking a loan from FUSAI that will allow her to purchase cement, sand and gravel.  Verónica Lissette is very grateful for the help and is committed to repaying her debt.

loans.use: purcahse cement, sand and gravel

loans.name: Sophany's Group

texts.en:
Sophany, 31, is married with three children residing in a rural village of the Kandieng district of Pursat province. To support the family, she has been farming rice for 11 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 54,000 per day and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for their future needs. 

Sophany is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Sambo's Group

texts.en: Sambo is a 55-year-old mother of four children residing in Battambang province. Her main sources of income are from raising chickens and trading recycled items. Sambo and her joint borrower, in a group of two, are new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and they are seeking a loan of 900,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy more chickens to raise and more recycled items to resell. She hopes that both businesses will run smoothly so she can gain a good income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and more recycled items

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Som, 51 years old and a widow, is a grocery seller living in Battambang province. After several years of involvement in her current business, she is able to earn up to 13,600 KHR per day.  This is the first micro loan for Som with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this cycle, she leads a group of four to get a new loan. She and her co-borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes that she can replenish her business on time and gain a high income to sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Начинающего бизнесмена зовут Нурулло, ему 40 лет, он проживает в районе Фархор на юге страны. Нурулло женат и имеет четверых детей школьного возраста. Недавно он купил помещение для магазина и хочет провести в нем ремонт. Здание является абсолютно без ремонта, даже стены не закончены. Нурулло знал, что ему придется нелегко и за мечтой о продуктовом магазине придется побороться и вложить немало усилий. Нурулло зная об этом, все равно купил помещение.
