She started a retail store trading in bicycles and bicycle spare parts. This idea was triggered by the poor means of transport used by the residents of her village at that time. 

Margret has since diversified into motorcycle spare parts due to an increase in the number of motorcycles in the region, and she has plans to sell motorcycles in the near future. Margret was introduced to the solar lanterns which provide bright and safe lighting and come with a mobile charging function by BrazAfric green energy marketing team. Because of the recurring cost and health effects associated with paraffin which is the commonly used lighting fuel in her community, she saw an opportunity to boost her sales, increase productivity and raise the living conditions of people in the community. 

Margret appreciates the benefits accruing from the use of solar lanterns, and with the Kiva financing option from Brazafric, she is seeking financing to purchase solar lanterns to stock and sell to her community. Margret points out that she would buy some solar lanterns to use in her farm and also for her shop to increase her working hours.

loans.use: to buy solar lanterns

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 48 years old. She is married with six children. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. Farmers need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Muasya

texts.en:
Muasya is a businesswoman who is very hard-working. She is a mother of three school-going children. She lives in her rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Muasya has operates a pool table business where her clients come to play table pool games. She has been in this business for the last three years. She cites maintenance costs as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan she wants to purchase another pool table for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase another pool table for her business

loans.name: Sadah

texts.en:
Sadah is divorced. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her largest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her two children.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereal shop in which she sells household consumables like wheat, rice, maize, and grains. She cites theft and competition as her major challenges in the business. 

She requests 30,000 KES to boost her cereal business by enabling her to purchase wheat, maize, rice, and grains to sell. She dreams of expanding into the wholesale market in the near future.

loans.use: to buy wheat, maize, rice, and grains to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 47 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Rolando y su hijo menor de 22 años, a quienes quiere  mucho. El negocio al que se dedica Nora son los tejidos artesanales, tiene su puesto de venta en el centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, en el cual vende las prendas que ella misma confecciona y que son rápidamente compradas por sus clientes, ya que los modelos que hace son muy novedosos. Además de surtir los mismos con variedades de telares y tapices de otros artesanos de la zona. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y desarrollar su creatividad, lleva 7 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto de venta sin poder salir, pero eso no la desanima ya que sabe que tiene que vender lo más rápido para poder cada 20 días darse un tiempo. Ya que su esposo llega de la mina donde trabaja y juntos comparten la mayor parte de su tiempo. Asimismo se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa una vez al año. Por todos los objetivos que está alcanzando, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su cuarto crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues mejorará su ingreso económico, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Nora, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de varias madejas de lana de carnero y alpaca para continuar con sus tejidos.
texts.en: Nora, who is 47, lives in the house which she inherited from her parents.  She lives there with her husband Rolando and her 22-year-old son, both of whom mean everything to her.  By nature, she is a very cheerful and sincere woman.  Nora sells hand-woven textiles from her stall in the craft centre in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She makes the clothes she sells herself and they are quickly snapped up by her customers because of her innovative designs.  She also stocks clothing made with different types of loom as well as tapestries from other local artisans.  Her favourite aspect of her work is weaving and developing her creative skills.  She has been doing this kind of work for 7 years and believes that the hardest part is having to remain behind her stall all day without being able to leave it.  She does not let this get her down, though, because she knows that she has to sell her goods as quickly as she can so that she can have a day off every 3 weeks. When her husband gets home from the mine where he works, they spend most of their time together.  In addition to running her textile business, she also does some farming, planting potatoes once a year.  Because she is achieving her goals, she hopes that, in time, she will be able to have a bigger shop where she can serve her customers more comfortably.  This is her fourth KIVA loan and she is very grateful for the financial help, as it will enable her to improve her income.  She guarantees that she will repay her loan punctually.  Nora will use the 500 soles to buy various skeins of lambs' and alpaca wool so that she can carry on producing her textiles.

loans.use: to buy lambs' and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario, de 37 años es un hombre trabajador. Vive en compañía de su esposa Manuela y sus 4 hijos, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada hace 2 años. De lunes a viernes durante las mañanas Mario, dedica su tiempo al trabajo de albañil, le va muy bien pues nunca la falta contratos para la fabricación de casas. Ya por las tardes, continua trabajando, pues desea sacar adelante a sus hijos. El mototaxi que adquirió le sirve para trasportar a las personas que viven en los alrededores de la ciudad, “en las tardes hay más movimiento, por ello trabajo durante esa hora”, menciona. Los sábados y domingos trabaja todo el día con su mototaxi, ya que hay afluencia de personas por la feria ganadera y de alimentos que se realiza en la ciudad. Ya tiene 10 años de experiencia en este negocio, su secreto es mantener a su vehículo siempre en buenas condiciones, “además de cuidar, cada año de uso vendo la motocarro para comprar una nueva, de esta manera no se devalúa ni malogra”, afirma. 
Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad económica, pues le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Mario, invertirá los S/.1500 en el pago de mantenimiento de su mototaxi de esa forma continuará trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Marío, 37 years old, is hard-working.  He lives with his wife, Manuela, and their four children.  Mario has been looking after them in a rented house for two years.  From Monday to Friday, Mario works as a builder in the morning.  The work is going well and he always has contracts to build houses.  He now also works in the afternoons as he wants his children to get ahead.  Mario has a motorcycle taxi which he uses to offer transportation to people who live in the city's outskirts.  Mario tells us that: "In the afternoon there are more people about, so I work at this time".  On Saturdays and Sundays he works with the motorcycle taxi all day long as there are a lot of people around, due to the cattle and food fairs held in the city.  Mario has had this business for ten years.  His secret is that he always keeps his vehicle in good condition.  He says, "As well as looking after the vehicle, every year I sell it so as to buy a new one.  That way the value of the vehicle doesn't fall, and it doesn't get damaged".

This is Mario's second Kiva loan.  He is grateful for this financial opportunity as it will help him to increase his income.  Mario promises to be punctual with his repayments.  Mario will invest this loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles in maintaining his motorcycle taxi and this way he will be able to continue working in peace.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, 25 years old and married to a policeman, has three children between the ages of five and one. She has been operating a retail shop in Rongai for a period of five years, earning an income of kes 13,500 monthly.

Amina is requesting her third loan of kes 100,000 from KADET LTD to purchase a stock of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, fat and tealeaves, among other stock, for her shop. The profits she will earn will be used to expand her current business and repay the loan.

Amina's dream is to see her business expand and have a healthy family with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy more maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, fat, and tealeaves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira, 45 años, vive en la casa que heredó de sus padres. Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo César y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes quiere mucho.
Ella se dedica a varias actividades durante el día. Tejiendo chullos (prendas para la cabeza), chalinas, guantes, telares. Ella disfruta mucho de tejer y lo hace muy hábilmente, sus tejidos los vende en su pequeño puesto ubicado en centro artesanal del poblado de San Pedro de Cajas, donde con mucha rapidez son adquiridos por sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, se divierte mucho haciéndolo y ese estado de ánimo lo refleja en los acabados de su trabajo, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad. Además de dedicarse a la siembra de papa una vez al año, esta característica hace la tierra sea más fértil y proporcione un buen producto. Por lo que obtiene buenas ganancias con ello. Asimismo recibe el apoyo de su esposo quien tiene una pequeña radio comunal en la localidad. Para más adelante espera ahorrar lo suficiente para poner una tienda de tejidos artesanales más grande, donde pueda vender sus prendas con mayor tranquilidad. Este es el cuarto crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo financiero recibido pues mejorará su ingreso económico, por ello promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Elvira, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de lanas de colores para continuar con sus tejidos.
texts.en:
Elvira is 45 years old and lives in the house that she inherited from her parents.  Elvira is a happy and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own house, alongside her husband, César, and her three, dear children, whom she loves very much.

Elvira makes a living through different work during the day.  She knits hats, scarves, gloves, and weaves products.  Elvira very much likes knitting and she is very skilled in this area.  She sells her products from a small stall in the artisan centre of the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  She always sells her products very quickly.  What Elvira most likes about her work is the knitting.  She really enjoys this activity, something which can be seen in the finished product.  Elvira has been doing this work for 32 years.  In addition, Elvira sows potatoes one a year.  She does it only once a year so that the land is more fertile and produces a good product.  Elvira earns good profits with this work.  She also receives support from her husband who has a communal radio in the town.  In the future, Elvira hopes to save enough money to open a bigger shop to sell the artisan, woolen products.  There she would be able to sell her products in peace.  This is Elvira's fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support as, with it, her income will improve.  Elvira promises to be punctual with her repayments. Elvira will invest the 1500 Nuevo Soles in buy coloured wools in order to continue knitting her products.

loans.use: to buy coloured wool so as to continue with her business.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: María una joven de 22 años que trabaja y estudia, actualmente cursa el 6to ciclo de la carrera de Administración y Negocios Internacionales. Decidió estudiar dicha carrera pues siempre pensó en emprender su propio negocio. Hace varios meses se desempeña de cajera, trabajo que le ha permitido cubrir los parte  de sus estudios. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo moral y económico que siempre le brindaron. Ser una profesional competitiva es su mayor anhelo. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra del pago de su matrícula. María agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a jóvenes como ella que buscan  superarse cada día.
texts.en: María is 22 years old and both works and studies.  She is currently in sixth semester of a degree in International Business Administration.  She chose this degree programme as she has always thought about starting her own business.  For some months, María has also been working as a cashier, which has allowed her to cover some of the costs of her studies.  María is grateful to her parents for the moral and financial support that they have always provided.  Being a competitive professional is María's biggest wish.  María will use this loan to pay university fees.  María is grateful to Kiva lenders for supporting young people, like her, who are always looking to overcome obstacles.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Maria Rebeca

texts.es: Maria Rebeca vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata en el distrito de Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo departamento  del Cusco, Perú. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar gallinas, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha esponsabilidad.
texts.en: Maria Rebeca lives in the city of Pilcopata, which is in the Kosñipata district of Paucartambo in Peru's Cusco department.  Her main source of income is agriculture, livestock and breeding small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She is currently applying for a loan to buy chickens,  She is very grateful for the loan which means a lot to her, and guarantees that he will repay his monthly instalments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Thim is 36 years old, married, and has given birth to three children with her husband. To make a living, she has been involved in farming. It is the major source of her family’s income. It is a traditional business. She has learned from older people, and it is the one core career she has been doing with her lovely husband. They are able to make a suitable income of 10,000 KHR to support their family.
In order to continue developing her business, she has turned to HKL for another loan opportunity. Thim completed two loan cycles prior to this loan. She has requested a loan in the amount of 1,200,000 KHR to purchase fertilizer and insecticides to apply to her cassava and rice crops. She plans to invest the income from the loan to create her own small business from her home to earn additional income. Thim also wants to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides to apply to her cassava and rice crops.

loans.name: Yealie

texts.en:
Yealie is 29 years old and married with three children between the age of 5 and 13 years. She runs a domestic products business in Jui in the eastern area of Freetown.

She's been in this business since 2007 and sells glass cups, knives, and food containers to her community. She says that the main problem in her business is that sometimes the bowls break.

Yealie requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a woman of 42 years, married to Peter and a mother of three children. She runs a general shop and also a music store. She has been in these businesses for seven years now. She earns a monthly income of 18,000 shillings.

This will be Lucy's first loan with KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to buy music CDs, rice, cooking oil, etc., to sell. In the future she wants to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase music CDs, rice, cooking oil, etc., to sell

loans.name: Faustin

texts.en:
Faustin is 50 years old. He has six children and has been a maize farmer for the past 30 years. He will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer to increase his production. He wishes to invest the profits from his farming in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 22-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He is a second-year student at a local university, where he studies psychology. His father is a construction worker and  his job is seasonal. He encourages his son to take his BA degree and find a good job to start his life. 

Ali has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. This laptop will help him a lot in studying and doing his homework. 

Ali appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Fatmata from Jui in the eastern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 and 12 years. For the past 10 years, Fatmata established her pharmacy business. She began her business because she wants to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price fluctuation and proper storage for her drugs.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more pain tablets, cholera medicine, and malaria drugs to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future Fatmata plans to open a big pharmacy. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more pain tablets, cholera medicine, and malaria drugs to sell.

loans.name: Priscillar

texts.en:
Priscillar is married with no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Priscillar has operated a clothes-selling business for the past three years. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the KSHS 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, bricks, cement and iron bars, and to pay for labor to make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with two school-going children who are the reason of her hard work. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

Rose is operating a cafe business preparing food, such as rice, tea, beans, chapati (flat bread), for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice and drinks for the business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of goods, maize flour, wheat flour, rice, and drinks for the business.

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en: Pavel is from Kapan town of Syuniq region. He lives with his wife and his little son and is installing heating systems for locals. He has been involved in this business for three years. The income from this activity is highly important for Pavel and his family. And as the winter is on its way, the demand for this service is currently increasing. Pavel has requested this loan to purchase tools and equipment required to do the installation. Pavel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. So, this loan is very important for Pavel to be able to provide a living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment to install heating systems

loans.name: Mougnou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Mougnou, composé  de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Binko, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de condiment  de charbon de bois, de céréales et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Mougnou sont à leur premier prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Doussou  la deuxième personne debout à partir de la droite, compte acheter 2 sacs de piment et 2 paniers de tomate avec ce   prêt chez les producteurs. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA qui sera réutilisé dans l’activité
texts.en:
The Mougnou Group is made up of married women who have an average of 41 years and an average of three children. They are all living in large traditional extended families in the village of Zanfina, municipality of Binko, prefecture of Baroueli, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through ties of kinship, vicinity, and friendship. They are merchants of "condiments" (vegetables used in local sauces), charcoal, grain and prepared food.The women of the Mougnou Group are currently on their first group loan.

The client Doussou is shown in the photo standing the second from the right. With her loan, she plans to purchase two sacks of peppers and two baskets of tomatoes from local producers. She hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 25,000 Francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of peppers and two baskets of tomatoes.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 50 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Zanfina, commune de Binko, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. 
Les femmes du groupe Sabaly sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter les différentes marchandises.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Awa  la première personne assise à partir de la gauche, compte acheter 50 kg de piment et 2 paniers de tomate qui seront vendus dans la ville de Fana. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 10000 FCFA qui sera  réutilisé dans l’activité et dans les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Sabaly Group is composed exclusively of married women, who have an average age of 50 years, and an average of three children. They are all living in large traditional extended families in the village of Zanfina, municipality of Binko, prefecture of Baroueli, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, vicinity, and friendship. The women of the Sabaly Group are currently on their first group loan, which will be used to buy various merchandise.

The client Awa is shown in the photo seated on the far left. With her loan, she plans to buy 50 kg of peppers and two baskets of tomatoes to be sold in the town of Fana. She hopes to earn an average monthly income of 10,000 Francs CFA which she will use to reinvest in her business and pay for family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Bith

texts.en:
Bith is 61 years old and a loving mother of seven children. Currently she lives with her honest husband and two children, while the other five children are already married and live separately in Kampong Cham province. She has been involved in the rice farming business, which is a main source of her family’s income. Normally, she is able to make an average income of KHR 10,000 per day.

Bith want to help her two sons who are employed as security guards. From month to month, they usually change their work spots according to the arrangement of the security company, so it’s hard for them without an owned motorcycle for commuting. Because of this reason, Bith decided to take a loan in the amount of KHR 2,400,000 to buy a motorcycle to help her sons with their transportation needs. This is her second loan from HKL. She has never been late in paying back any of her loan in the previous cycle. Thanks lenders for the support. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help her sons in their transportation needs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old. She will use her Kiva loan to pay labor costs and buy fertilizer during her maize production.:She needs to buy fertilizer to increase her production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 


This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay labor costs and purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a very hardworking widow from Olkalou. She is 47 years old and supports her three children, ages 18, 17 and 15 years old.

She is a farmer who has been into this business for the last ten years. She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 25,000 from Kadet Ltd., which will assist her in buying fertilizer and chicken feeds.

Her monthly income is KES 15,000, and has plans of using the anticipated profits from her improved business in paying school fees for her children.
Her hopes and dreams for her future business is to be the best farmer in her area and for her family to be happy and healthy.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and they live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business and get a variety of khangas for sale.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of khangas for resale.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua is a rope maker. She is married to Toko, and together they are blessed with five children. Syombua has been making ropes for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which she uses to provide basic necessities for her family. 

Syombua is applying for her second loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to buy more sisal and employ more workers to boost on the business profitability. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will pay school fees for her children. 

Syombua's hopes and dreams are to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy more sisal and employ more workers

loans.name: Albeiro

texts.es: Albeiro es un hombre campesino de 45 años de edad, 30 de ellos dedicados a realizar las actividades del campo, las cuales aprendió de sus padres. Es una víctima más del desplazamiento forzado por la violencia.  Actualmente labora como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región donde reside y alterna su empleo dedicándose a la producción de leche de manera independiente, pues posee vacas lecheras y una novillona que están ubicadas en un terreno familiar; de esta forma complementa los ingresos con los cuales lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su humildad, dedicación y pujanza le han permitido ir progresando poco a poco, sobrepasando diversos obstáculos que se le presentan a nivel económico. Solicita el crédito como apoyo para continuar con su actividad independiente, pues desea comprar una vaca productora de leche y una novillona, con las que podrá aumentar su producción y generar mejores ingresos para su familia. Albeiro sueña con fortalecer cada día más su negocio de producción, trabajar arduamente para que le dé una buena rentabilidad y así pasar de ser empleado a empresario totalmente independiente y poder dedicar más tiempo a su familia y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Albeiro is a man from the countryside aged 45. He has spent 30 of these working in farming activities, which he learned from his parents. He is yet another victim of  forced displacement due to violence. He currently works as a labourer in various farms in the area in which he lives. He alternates his job with producing milk as an independent farmer, as he owns milk cows and a heifer which he keeps on a family plot. In this way, he supplements his earnings, which he uses to support his family. 

His humility, dedication and strength have allowed him to move forwards little by little, overcoming various economic obstacles. He is requesting this loan to help him to continue with his independent activities. He would like to buy a dairy cow and a heifer, with which he will be able to increase his output and boost earnings for his family.

Albeiro dreams of strengthening his milking business more each day, of working hard so that it is profitable for him, so that he can go from being employed to being a fully independent businessman. This will allow him to dedicate more time to his family and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and a heifer.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a lawyer with many years of experience working in that field. She lives in Gyumri town with her daughter and provides legal services to locals in Gyumri town. She is doing her job with great love and care and does her best to provide good living conditions for her daughter.

Now, this hard working woman needs financial support to be able to purchase new office supplies and a computer, which is very important for her work. Anna has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is very important for Anna and she will be very grateful to all her lenders for the help.

loans.use: to pay for new office supplies and a computer

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI, composé exclusivement de femmes mariées, qui ont en moyenne 49 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Dibida, commune de kalake, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce  de céréales, des tissus et de la restauration.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur sixième prêt solidaire.                                                                                                                                                                                                 
La cliente Mariam  la deuxième personne à gauche dans le rang des assises, est restauratrice elle compte acheter 2 sacs de riz et des condiments.  Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 25000 FCFA qui sera dépensé dans les problèmes familiaux.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri Group is composed exclusively of married women who have an average age of 49 years and an average of four children. They are all living in large traditional extended families in the village of Dibida, municipality of Kalake, prefecture of Baroueli, in the Segou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, vicinity, and friendship. The women of the Tiessiri group are merchants of grain, textiles and prepared food, and are currently on their sixth group loan.

The client Mariam is shown in the photo seated second from the left. She is a restaurateur, and intends to use her loan to purchase two sacks of rice and condiments (vegetables used for local sauces). She hopes to earn a monthly revenue of 25,000 Francs CFA, which will be spent on family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of rice and condiments (vegetables used for local sauces).

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is 28 years old and married to Joseph. They are both blessed with two children. She has been in this business for the last two years with a monthly income of KES 9,000. Anna managed to get her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to purchase more stock. She will use the anticipated profit to increase her savings. Her hope and dream is to be a successful woman.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to empower the business

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Meet Jeneba, she is 45 years old, from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. In 2008, Jeneba established her Palm Oil business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge is lack of enough capital to expand her business. 

Jeneba requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Jeneba plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Moain

texts.en: Moain is a young man of 28 years. He is living in Sana'a and married. Moain's main business is a stationary store based in Sana'a. He gained access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his business activities. He is very friendly and has already gained some permanent customers. Due to the current bad situation which Yemen has met, however, his business has had lower profits and fewer customers. So, he requested a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy additional stationery materials and use as working capital to increase his sales since this type of product is very popular. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory for his stationery business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old, married to Margaret and supporting nine children who are in school.

He has a bakery shop in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has been running for five years. He has applied for his first loan from Kadet Ltd to buy flour and other stock. With the anticipated profit, he plans to buy modern bakery equipment.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his bakery.

loans.use: To buy flour and other bakery items

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie is 39 years old and supports a family of two. She has been in the cereals business for the last two years with a monthly income of KSHS 20,000. She manages to get her first loan from Kadet Ltd for KSHS 20,000, which she plans to use to purchase more business stock. She will use her anticipated profit to buy a plot for herself. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her cereals business and buy a lorry to supply cereals out of the country.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Damien is 40 years old. He is married and has five children. He will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor costs

loans.name: Annonciathe

texts.en:
Annonciathe is 51 years old.  She is a mother of five children, aged between 6 and 28. She will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for  maize production.  She needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase her crop production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor costs

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a 40-year-old man from the Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  He supports 7 people in his family.  He is married to Mukatha, who is also a business lady and provides a little support to the family.  He has one child who is 15 years old.

Evans sells charcoal, a business he has been doing for the last 2 years, and gets a monthly income of KES 2500.  He is requesting for a loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to improve on his business.  He will use the anticipated profit to open a retail shop.

His dream is to open a retail shop and so as to increase his stock, this will enable him to better his family's life.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is 41 years old. She is a widow with two children. She will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for maize production.  She needs  to buy fertilizer in order to increase crop production. With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: pay for fertilizer and labor cost

loans.name: Deo

texts.en: Deo used his previous loan to buy general merchandise to sell.  He is a 43-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Thirteen years ago he decided to start a retail shop in order to earn money to support his family. Like most traders, he faces the challenges of price fluctuations and high license fees and his dreams are to educate his children up to the University and trading in wholesale.  Deo intends to use this loan to buy sodas, water and flour to sell.

loans.use: buy sodas, water and flour to sell

loans.name: Fidele

texts.en:
Fidele is 57 years old. He is married to a wife who is a farmer. They have five children.  Fidele will use this Kiva loan to pay for labor costs and fertilizer for  maize production.  They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming Fidele wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kitchen utensils for resale

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is 24 years old and is married. She has 2 children, aged 3, 1 and 1/2 years which she supports. She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer.

Sera has a tailoring shop which has lasted for two years now and is located at Kibaoni.  In her business she earns a monthly income of KSH 6,000. 

Sera is taking her second loan of KSH 15, 000, which she intends to use for adding stock to her business by buying materials, zippers and fabric. Her previous loan of KSH 10,000 was paid back successfully.  

Sera will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to educate her children and to expand her tailoring shop.

loans.use: buy sewing materials and supplies

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel has been involved in aviculture for 5 years. Near the town where he lives, Manvel owns a small area where he breeds turkeys and chickens.  To be able to enlarge his business, Narek needs financial support. As a hard working man, he asked a loan to able to purchase turkeys and chickens and forage for feeding them. 

The income from aviculture is very important for Manvel to cover his family's costs.  Manvel is a father of two school-age children and together with his wife does his best to provide a better life for them. 

Manvel has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Manvel and he will be very grateful to all his lenders for giving him an opportunity to enlarge his business

loans.use: buy turkeys, chickens and feed

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Fatmata from Jui eastern area in Sierra Leone. She is single with 1 child age 1 year.  For over 2 years, Fatmata has worked to establish her retail business. She began her business because she wants to create income to support her child and her parent. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that at present she is faced with high competition in the market.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more soft drinks, biscuits, and pure water for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to open a bigger shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, biscuits, and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Josen

texts.en:
Josen is 37 years old and married with two children, ages 15 and 16.  He and his family live in Chingola, Zambia, where he operates a Zoona mobile money transfer outlet and works as a schoolteacher.  
 
Josen is requesting his second Kiva loan. The first loan was used to help increase his working capital float in order to service more customers and earn additional profit. With the second loan, he hopes to continue his businesses growth by increasing his cash and electronic funds. He explains how having enough funds on hand is important to serve all the customers at his shop.  Right now, he is unable to serve all his customers as efficiently as he would like because of his limited working capital.

Josen explains how the growth from his first Kiva loan has improved his family's quality of life with the extra income he now earns. He has begun saving for his children’s college education with his Zoona outlet profits. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To grow his Zoona money transfer business by adding to his working capital, which will allow him to serve more customers who are sending and receiving money at his shop

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu, a 29-year-old from Jui in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with one child aged three years old. In 2011, Isatu established her egg business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to expand it. 

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fresh eggs to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Isatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Jussely

texts.es: Jussely, de 32 años, es una joven madre de familia trabajadora, vive junto a su esposo Roger y su querida hija en su casa propia. La actividad a la que se dedica, es el cultivo de choclos, papas, alverjas, etc, en las chacras que heredo de sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego cosechar sus productos y venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 13 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. Para más adelante, espera poner un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su quinto préstamo con KIVA, en todo este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable y comprometida con su asociación. Jussely, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, pues están en temporada de cosecha y falta muy poco para que termine de madurar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Jussely, 32 years old, is a young mother from a hard-working family. She lives with her husband Roger and her dear daughter in their own home. Her livelihood is growing corn, potatoes, peas, etc., on the small plots of land that she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day to later harvest her products and sell them in the wholesale market of the city of Tarma.

What she likes most about her work is the freedom she has in carrying it out, as she is the one who decides what is best for her crops. She has been doing this work for 13 years, and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her products to market. This is because most of the time it is very difficult for her to find a vehicle that wants to take her. 

In the future she hopes to set up a stand in the market, as she is sure that she will improve her income this way. This is her fifth loan with Kiva, and in all this time she has shown herself to be a responsible person, committed to her group. 

Jussely will spend the 3800 soles to buy organic fertilizer for nourishing her crops, as it is harvest season and very little time is left for her crops to finish maturing.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: Marta Isabel, de 43 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad desde hace 25 años. Cuenta con una familia numerosa la cual está conformada por su esposo y sus cinco hijos, uno de los cuales está estudiando en la Universidad y los otros cuatro se encuentran en la escuela.  Doña Marta es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora  y responsable, su deseo es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones a las que ella y su esposo han tenido. Debido a lo anterior solicita este Pequeño préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en su pequeño negocio el cual consiste en una tienda de productos de belleza tal como se puede observar en la fotografía, además cuenta con un pequeño horno artesanal donde elabora pan dulce y lo vende dentro de su comunidad, estas son las principales fuentes de ingreso de Doña Marta con lo cual ha logrado aportar a la economía de su hogar junto a su esposo. El crédito lo usará para comprar más productos para su negocio y espera poder aumentar sus ingresos y así dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta Isabel is 43 years old and has lived in her own home for the past 25 years. She has a large family, made up of her husband and five children, one of whom is studying at university, and the other four at school. Marta is an enterprising, hard-working and responsible woman, who wants better things for her children than her and her husband had. 

Because of this, she is requesting this small loan from FUSAI to invest in her small business, which consists of a shop selling beauty products like those shown in the photo. She also has a small , homemade oven in which she bakes sweet bread which she sells within her community. These are Marta's main sources of income, with which she has managed to contribute to the household income along with her husband. 

She will use the loan to buy more products for her business and she hopes that she can boost her earnings so as to offer her children better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy lotion, cosmetics, deodorant, cream, etc.

loans.name: Riskiya

texts.ru: Ризкия женщина с доброй душой. Она целеустремленная и трудолюбивая женщина. Ризкия вдова и имеет 2 детей. Она единственная кормилица и надежда своих детей. Она более 12 лет занимается бизнесом. Ризкия печет лепешки, и продает на местном рынке. Она имеет свой цех. Ризкия уже имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу и поэтому легко справляется с бизнесом. Ризкия должна увеличить оборотный капитал и развевать бизнес, так как она нуждается больше дохода. Ее дети год за годом требуют всё больше благ. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1300 долларов США для покупки муки и угля. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Riskiya is a woman with a good heart. She is a single-minded and hard-working woman. Riskiya is a widow with two children. She is the only caretaker and hope for her children. She has more than twelve years of experience in business. Riskiya bakes cakes and sells them in the local market. She has her own shop. Riskiya already has a lot of experience and so she can easily meet the needs of the business. Riskiya must increase her working capital and expand the business because she needs a larger income. Every year her children require more. She is asking for a loan of $1,300 US to buy flour and coal. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy flour and coal to increase sales.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат молодая и целеустремленная девушка. Ей 20 лет. Она не замужем. Мухабат после окончания средней школы научилась у портнихи шитью женской одежды. Она за несколько лет развивала свои навыки и теперь хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она обучилась на курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет предоставлять услуги портнихи и таким образом зарабатывать деньги и стать успешной в жизни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 долларов США для покупки швейной машинки и машинки для вышивки. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Muhabat is a young and ambitious girl. She is 20 years old. She is not married. After graduating from high school, Muhabat learned how to sew women's clothes from the dressmaker. She has spent a few years developing her skills and now wants to start a business. She took the class "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women and received a certificate. She wants to provide services to dressmakers and thereby make money and become successful in life. She is asking for a loan of $2,000 US to buy sewing and embroidery machines. She's awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: buy sewing and embroidery machines for her new business

loans.name: Bozor

texts.ru: Бозору 51 год. Он с женой, тремя сыновьями и двумя дочерьми проживает в городе Дангара. Его жена и дочери занимаются домашним хозяйством, старший сын таксист, средний студент, а младщий учится в школе. Бозор имеет среднее техническое образование, он водитель. Одновременно Бозор более 6 лет занимается купле-продажей мелкорогатого и крупнорогатого скота. В работе на скотном дворе ему помогает сын. Бозор в данный момент нуждается в кредите, чтобы совершить покупку двух голов коров. Такой закуп позволит бизнесу Бозора развиваться дальше.
texts.en: Bozor is 51 years old. He, his wife, three sons, and two daughters live in Dangara. His wife and daughters keep house. His eldest son is a taxi driver. The middle son is a university student, and the youngest son goes to school.  Bozor has a technical education. He is a driver. Additionally, Bozor has more than six years of experience buying and selling smaller livestock and cattle. His son helps him in the barnyard. Bozor currently needs a loan to buy two cows. This will allow Bozor to further develop his business.

loans.use: buy two cows.

loans.name: Jean Nepomuscene

texts.en:
Jean Nepomuscene is 54 years old. He is the father of six children. He will use the Kiva loan to support labor and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor and fertilizer costs during maize production

loans.name: Jaminatu

texts.en:
Meet Jaminatu, a 38-year-old from Jui in the eastern area from Freetown. She is married with two children. In 2008, Jaminatu established her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting her goods from town to her operation area. It is very difficult.

Jaminatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cement to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Jaminatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cement to expand her business.

loans.name: Baindu

texts.en:
Baindu is 38 years old and married with four children between the ages of six and thirteen years old. She runs a business selling domestic products in Jui, in the Eastern area from Freetown.

She's been in this business for 15 years and sells glass cups, knives and food containers to her community. She says that the main problem of her business is sometimes slow purchasing power.

Baindu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons and a variety of food containers for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 51 years old. He is married with five children. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizer during maize production. They need to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that, in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

This loan is part of Urwego Opportunity Bank's program targeting farmers who are members of cooperatives. The loan goes to the cooperative's leader (pictured) on the group's behalf, and all borrowers benefiting from this loan receive financing such as quality seeds from the Rwandan government. The loan is also covered by insurance in case of crop failure.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывает двоих детей (1 дочь, 1 сын). В 1997 году, начала бизнес в торговле косметикой и мыломоющими средствами, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 1,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Гульмира имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 22,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, Гульмира смогла увеличить товарооборот и развить свой бизнес. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товарооборота. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в товарооборот и накопить деньги на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Gulmira is 48 years old, married, and has two children (one daughter and one son) with her husband. In 1997, she started her business selling cosmetics and household chemicals. She started her business with 1,000 KGS start-up capital. Since she managed to grow her business and find loyal customers, Gulmira now has an average monthly income of 22,000 KGS. Thanks her hard work, Gulmira managed to increase sales and grow her business. In order to further improve and expand her business, Gulmira asked the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 130,000 KGS to increase sales. Gulmira plans to invest her profits from the loan into the business and save money on a wedding celebration for her son.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and household chemicals.

loans.name: Muhabat

texts.ru: Мухабат родилась в 1966 года. Она любимая мать 4 детей. Мухабат более 10 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Мухабат занимается купле продажей молочных продуктов как кефир, молоко, сметана и т.п. Она торгует на местном рынке и имеет свою торговую точку. Мухабат единственная кормилица своих 4 детей. Она должна проводить свадебное торжество своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 900 долларов США для проведения свадебного торжества. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ей сделать счастливым сына.
texts.en: Muhabat was born in 1966. She is the loving mother of four children. Muhabat has more than ten years of business experience. Muhabat works buying and selling dairy products such as yogurt, milk, sour cream, etc. She sells them in the local market where she has a shop. Muhabat is the sole breadwinner for her four children. She wants to hold a wedding celebration for her son, but has no money. She is asking for a loan of $900 US for a wedding celebration. She's awaiting your kindness and hoping for your mercy. This loan will help her make her son happy.

loans.use: pay for a wedding party

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 20 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Isaías, su esposo desde hace tres años. Aunque no tienen hijos, ellos viven en armonía en casa de su madre desde que nació. Desde que falleció su padre, ella tuvo que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos del hogar por ello, todas las mañanas desde muy temprano sale a cuidar de sus sembríos de maíz y papa. Aunque formó su familia, ella continúa en esta labor, sobre todo porque le gusta mucho. Pero consiente que tiene que afrontar nuevas metas y responsabilidades. Comenzó a trabajar en la elaboración de leña. “Todo depende del tamaño del árbol”, afirma. Ya que su trabajo consiste en cortar la mayor cantidad de leña, en un árbol grande sale un promedio de 2 millares de leña, pero si son chiquitas solo ochocientas unidades. Eso le ayuda a ella a solventar algunos gastos. Pero ahora necesita el dinero para nutrir sus sembríos con abono, pues comenzará la temporada de cosecha. Este es el segundo crédito con KIVA, agradece la oportunidad económica, pues le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Por lo que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Julia, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Julia, 20, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Isaías, her husband of three years.  Although they don't have children, they live together in her mother's house, where she has lived since she was born.

Julia has had to work to help with the household expenses since her father died.  Every morning she leaves very early to take care of her corn and potato plants.  Although she has started her own family, she keeps doing this work because she likes it a lot, but she allows that she has to face new goals and responsibilities.

Julia has started producing firewood.  "Everything depends on the size of the tree," she says.  Her job consists of cutting the largest quantity of firewood.  A large tree yields an average of 2,000 units of firewood, but a small tree only 800.  This helps her cover some of her expenses.

Now Julia needs the money to nourish her plants with soil amendments because the harvest season is about to begin.  This is her second Kiva loan.  She's grateful for the economic opportunity because it will help her improve her income, and she promises to make her payments punctually.

Julia will invest the 1500 soles [PEN] in organic soil amendments to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Meet Jariatu, she is a 28-year-old woman from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with one child.  For the past six years, Jariatu has been running her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to generate a permanent source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the difficulty in transporting her goods from town to her operation area.

Jariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more cement to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Jariatu plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cement to expand her business.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Kaitha is a 5-year-old a shopkeeper. He is married to Agnes and together they are blessed with five children. Kaitha has been running his retail shop for the past three years with a monthly income of KSH 20,000 which he uses to provide for his family. 

Kaitha is applying for his third loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to buy stock e.g. stationery, cooking oil, fat, flour, etc.  With the anticipated profit from the business he will pay school fees for his children. 

Kaitha hopes and dreams to offer his children quality education.

loans.use: restock his store

loans.name: Mesalim

texts.en:
Masalim is a divorced  mother of one child. She stays at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her child. 

Masalim operates a fruits and vegetable selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is stiff competition from other fellow sellers. 

With this Ksh 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and various vegetables at wholesale and resell them at a profit. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng is 39 years old and married to Lon, a rice farmer and the father of their two children. The couple owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice and beans. They have been farming for over 10 years and usually earn about $2.80 per day apiece. The farm is their only source of income.

Chheng would like to improve their farm in order to increase their income. She would like to ensure that she has healthier crops and high production, but she has insufficient funds to do so. Therefore, Chheng has requested a loan of 1,500 US dollars to buy a plot of farmland. She will also use a portion of the loan to improve their home. 

Someday, with consistent effort, determination and patience, Chheng and her spouse hope to achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland and make home improvements.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married, and has five children. Ali is the sole provider for his family.

Ali owns a grocery store where he mainly specializes in selling sugar and candies for children. He is the only person with such a profession in the surrounding area, which has given him an excellent reputation. Ali has been practicing this business since 2010 and has gained good experience in this field.

Ali is requesting a loan of $1,500. The aim of this loan is to pay the annual rent of his grocery store and to increase his inventory of goods for sale. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his grocery store and to increase his inventory of goods for sale

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Marie from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children.  In 2006, Marie established her retail business. She began her business because she did not go school and she was trained in business.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that at present her business is doing fine because the public market is far from where the people live. 

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees, and support her family. In the future, Marie wants to build a shop so that she can expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Zamirkul

texts.ru: Замиркул 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Замиркул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Замиркул занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Замиркул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 лошадь, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 3,800 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замиркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Замиркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение свадебного торжества для сына.
texts.en: Zamirkul is 40, married, and raising 3 children together with her husband. She has the equivalent of a high school education and raises livestock for a living, having started 11 years ago with 20,000 somoni worth of animals. Thanks to her persistent efforts, she currently has a horse and 5 sheep, while her monthly income is nearly 3,800 somoni.  To further develop her farm, Zamirkul is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum and Partners.  She hopes to borrow 50,000 somoni to buy more sheep for her farm, and plans to use her increased income due to the loan to buy even more livestock, as well as to save money for her son's wedding reception.

loans.use: buy sheep

loans.name: Yeama

texts.en:
Meet Yeama, she is in her late forties and lives in Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  In 2008, Yeama established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the difficulty in transporting goods from one village to another.

Yeama requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and ground nuts to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Yeama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and ground nuts to expand her business.

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu lives in Matuga, Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Zainabu is married and has seven children. Both she and her husband have been farming for twenty years, and are currently growing cashew nuts on their land. She is looking forward to becoming a beekeeper because it will give her a source of honey for medicinal use. 

This is Zainabu’s first loan with Kiva, and she plans to use the income generated by her beehives to start a poultry project on her land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is 40 years old and married with three children between the age of 4 and 11 years. She runs a fish-selling business in Jui Eastern area in Freetown. She's been in this business for nine years and sells fish in her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is sometimes slow purchasing power.

Mariatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy fish to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business more than ever. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Meet Isatu. She is 28 years old from Jui, eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 3 children. In 2005, Isatu established her Fish business. She began her business because she wants generates a permanent source of income. She works in the business from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is if the fish did not finish, it will be spoiled.

Isatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future, Isatu plans to become an agent of Fishery Company. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to expand her business.
